title.narrative: INCREASED CAPACITY OF SERVICE PROVIDERSFOR INTEGRATED SERVICES FOR ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, through the Programme Component â€œEducation, Protection and Adolescent Development", children, adolescent and youth, boys and girls learn, acquire the academic and social skills necessary for their optimal development and are protected from all forms of violence and abuse.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: With the technical and financial support of UNICEF, 732 teachers (243 women and 489 men) received a quality educational service package that enabled them to teach in a safe school environment despite the COVID-19 pandemic, resulting in improvement of learning outcomes for 142,609 students (70,420 girls and 72.189 boys). The Congo has now a modern civil registration system thanks to partnership between UNCHR, UNICEF and UNFPA regarding birth registration and fighting againststatelessness.At the same time, with UNICEF support, 3,722 children without birth certificate will be able to enjoy their right to identity and citizen of the Congo | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
